item.title: Interlock ransomware gang pushes fake IT tools in ClickFix attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang now uses ClickFix attacks that impersonate IT tools to breach corporate networks and deploy file-encrypting malware on devices. [...]

item.title: OpenAI details ChatGPT-o3, o4-mini, o4-mini-high usage limits
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI has launched three new reasoning models - o3, o4-mini, and o4-mini-high for Plus and Pro subscribers, but as it turns out, these models do not offer 'unlimited' usage. [...]

item.title: FBI: Scammers pose as FBI IC3 employees to 'help' recover lost funds
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warns that scammers posing as FBI IC3 employees are offering to "help" fraud victims recover money lost to other scammers. [...]

item.title: ASUS warns of critical auth bypass flaw in routers using AiCloud
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ASUS is warning about an authentication bypass vulnerability in routers with AiCloud enabled that could allow remote attackers to perform unauthorized execution of functions on the device. [...]

item.title: SonicWall SMA VPN devices targeted in attacks since January
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability affecting SonicWall Secure Mobile Access (SMA) appliances has been under active exploitation since at least January 2025, according to cybersecurity company Arctic Wolf. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers target Russian govt with upgraded RAT malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Chinese-speaking IronHusky hackers are targeting Russian and Mongolian government organizations using upgraded MysterySnail remote access trojan (RAT) malware. [...]

item.title: 7 Steps to Take After a Credential-Based cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Hackers don't break in—they log in. Credential-based attacks now fuel nearly half of all breaches. Learn how to scan your Active Directory for compromised passwords and stop attackers before they strike. [...]

item.title: Cisco Webex bug lets hackers gain code execution via meeting links
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco has released security updates for a high-severity Webex vulnerability that allows unauthenticated attackers to gain client-side remote code execution using malicious meeting invite links. [...]

item.title: Critical Erlang/OTP SSH pre-auth RCE is 'Surprisingly Easy' to exploit, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A critical vulnerability in the Erlang/OTP SSH, tracked as CVE-2025-32433, has been disclosed that allows for unauthenticated remote code execution on vulnerable devices. [...]

item.title: Entertainment services giant Legends International discloses data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Entertainment venue management firm Legends International warns it suffered a data breach in November 2024, which has impacted employees and people who visited venues under its management. [...]

item.title: Windows NTLM hash leak flaw exploited in phishing attacks on governments
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A Windows vulnerability that exposes NTLM hashes using .library-ms files is now actively exploited by hackers in phishing campaigns targeting government entities and private companies. [...]

item.title: Chrome extensions with 6 million installs have hidden tracking code
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A set of 57 Chrome extensions with 6,000,000 users have been discovered with very risky capabilities, such as monitoring browsing behavior, accessing cookies for domains, and potentially executing remote scripts. [...]

item.title: Ahold Delhaize confirms data theft after INC ransomware claims attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Food retail giant Ahold Delhaize confirms that data was stolen from its U.S. business systems during a November 2024 cyberattack. [...]
